Modbus Master Custom Device

This Custom Device allows for communication between VeriStand a Modbus slave.

Configuring a new Modbus Master

Common Settings

Name: The unique name for this Custom Device in the System Explorer.
Interface Type: The desired communication interface for the Master. TCP Master communicates over TCP/IP, and Serial Master communicates over RS-232 or RS-485.
Maximum Channels Per Read: The Modbus Master uses group reads when possible to reduce the network load. This setting defines how many contiguous channels can be read in a single group. A smaller setting will result in more reads that take less time per read, a larger setting will result in less reads that require more time per read.
Read Refresh Rate(ms): This is the rate which the device will poll the slave for new data. The device will never poll faster than this rate, but reading all of the channels can take longer than the specified rate. You can monitor whether this rate is achieved at runtime by monitoring the Late Read Count channel.

TCP Master

Address: The IP Address of the slave device.
Port: THe port for the TCP/IP connection.
Timeout(ms): The desired network timeout.

Serial Master

VISA resource name: The serial resource to use. This can be found in NI Measurement and Automation Explorer.
Unit ID: Modbus supports up to 255 slave devices, and the Unit ID is the unique identifier of each slave device.
Baud Rate: The common speed that all connected devices will communicate at. You can select a value or manually enter a unique value.
flow control (none): Sets the serial port's flow control.
parity (even): Sets the serial port's parity.
serial type: Sets the serial packet type. Modbus supports RTU and ASCII packets.
Data Bits: This setting is determined by the serial type per the Modbus specification.
Stop Bits: This setting is determined by the parity per the Modbus specification.
